csv_format_facets_line_1: First line: facets list separated by semicolons (facet1;facet2;facet;...)
csv_format_facets_line_end: Following lines: username;facet value1; facet value2;facet value2;...
csv_format_user_list: Format: username, administrative code or email list separated by a carriage return
csv_users_import_infos_by_full_name_2_te: Two different formats are available here :
csv_users_import_infos_by_full_name_a: The identifier of a user may be omitted if his name and first name have been mentioned. (In that case the following format is required ";<Role>;<Last name>;<First name>" with a ";" in front of the role)
csv_users_import_infos_by_full_name_b: If another user on the platform has exactly the same name and first name, the identifier is compulsory.
csv_users_import_infos_by_full_name_nb:
NB : Both formats can be used in the same .csv file.
For excel users: Save as: ".csv delimeter : semicolon"
csv_users_import_infos_by_full_name_semi: (Make sure to insert a ";" at the beginning of the line, to indicate an empty first column)
csv_users_import_infos_format_a: User information must be defined in one line and separated by semicolon
csv_users_import_infos_format_b: Note that you don't need to add a file header
csv_users_import_infos_ws_role_a: The default roles are "Collaborator" and "Manager" and the values that have to be used in the CSV are respectively "collaborator" and "manager"
csv_users_import_infos_ws_role_b: If these roles are modified, the new names have to be used in the CSV
csv_workspaces_import_infos_format_a: Workspaces information must be defined in one line and separated by semicolon

import_resources_explanation:
The "import" button helps import a workspace or resource on the platform after having exported it. The resource import requires a zip file generated by claroline containing the file manifest.yml.

If you want to upload a file, this is not the function you're looking for. To do so click on "Add" then "File". If you want to import an other zip file, please create a new "File" resource and select "Uncompress" on the pop-up window.

resource_icon_set_illustrator_help: Optimal SVG export options for Adobe Illustrator
resource_icon_set_illustrator_options:
Profile: SVG 1.1
Fonts: Convert to outline
Image location: Embed
CSS Properties: Style Attributes
resource_icon_set_info_text:
Please provide the pack's name and a .zip file containing your icons as well. You can use the list of icons below to guide you through.
ATTENTION! Name your files using the same filename as the one indicated in this list. The filename is used to match your icon with the appropriate resource type.
Fox example the icon 'text.png' will be attributed by the system to the resource type 'text'.
It is not necessary to include all the icons in your file. For all the missing icons, the ones by default will be used instead.
You are not required to use a particular image extension. You are advised however to use .svg (or .png if the .svg option is not possible) for an optimum displaying result.
The advised image dimensions are: 71px X 80px.
